# Czech Republic national under-19 football team

4–1 (Lipnice, Czech Republic; 18 September 2001)
| Largest win        =  13–0 (Mnichovo Hradiště, Czech Republic; 13 October 2001)
| Largest loss       =  5–1 (Tallinn, Estonia; 21 May 2009)
| Regional name      = FIFA U-20 World Cup
| Regional cup apps  = 6
| Regional cup first = 1983
| Regional cup best  = Runners-up (2007)
| 2ndRegional name      = European Championship
| 2ndRegional cup apps  = 7
| 2ndRegional cup first = 2002
| 2ndRegional cup best  = Runners-up (2011)
}}
The Czech Republic national under-19 football team is the national under-19 football team of the Czech Republic and is controlled by the Football Association of the Czech Republic. The team competes in the UEFA European Under-19 Championship, held every year. As of June 2011, their biggest achievement is third place in the UEFA European Under-19 Championships, which they have achieved on three occasions: 2003, 2006 and 2008.

The following players were called up for two friendly matches against Liechtenstein on 9–12 October 2025.
